intro: Haplopappus venetus var. decumbens, commonly known as the decumbent eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in flat-topped inflorescences. It is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its historical use in traditional medicine.
